column4: For anyone wishing to have different wall papers on different workspaces here is the tutorial http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=69507&highlight=add+workspace
is it easy to make a shortcut to tell terminal a list of commands?
davey: did you get my link? How do i make one?
oh haha
thank you
davey: http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=69507&highlight=add+workspace
davey: tru dat
davey: i tryed saving the command as a sh file but when i open, it comes up in the text editor and when i tryed opening with terminal, it did nothing. Can you run me through how do do it
davey: you mean make it an exe?
chmod +x file
I told you, chmod +x file
why not run it from terminal ?
does the same thing for me
how exactly did you create it ?
to test it, go into terminal and type in ./blah.sh
it runs fine ?
same thing happens to mine. Only works once in a while.
did you mark the box that says run in terminal ?
no idea than. I know that's the same thing mine does, so it might be something with running scripts from terminal automatically
how is that ?
or you can do chmod a+x
a+x marks them all as execute. +x doesnt
